title: Benchmarking Multimodal RAG through a Chart-based Document Question-Answering Generation Framework
author: Yuming Yang (Chongqing University), Jiang Zhong (Chongqing University), Li Jin (Chinese Academy of Sciences), Jingwang Huang (Chongqing University), Jingpeng Gao (Chongqing University), Qing Liu (Chinese Academy of Sciences), Yang Bai (Chinese Academy of Sciences), Rui Jiang (Chongqing University), Kaiwen Wei (Chongqing University)
background: This work focuses on enhancing retrieval-augmented generation models by introducing a new task that evaluates their performance on chart-based question-answering.
contribution: This paper introduces Chart-based Multimodal Retrieval-Augmented Generation (MRAG) and a framework named CHARGE to generate high-quality evaluation samples through structured keypoint extraction and generation techniques.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing multimodal benchmarks mostly address simple image-text interactions and lack the complexity of chart-based evaluations, leading to limitations in understanding dense visual data.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work utilizes a structured pipeline for keypoint extraction and generation specifically designed for interacting with charts, improving the assessment of multimodal models in dense information environments.

key_innovation: The method uniquely combines chart data with textual content in a systematic way to create challenging evaluation scenarios for models, enhancing the capabilities of multimodal reasoning.
real_world_impact: This research could significantly impact various fields that utilize data visualization, such as education, business analytics, and scientific research, by improving the interaction models with complex data formats like charts.

new_terms.Multimodal Retrieval-Augmented Generatio: **Multimodal Retrieval-Augmented Generation (MRAG)** refers to methods that enhance model performance by integrating external knowledge across different data modalities, like text and images.
new_terms.keypoint extraction: **Keypoint extraction** involves identifying and extracting critical pieces of information from complex data sources, which serves as a core component for understanding and generating responses.

open_sourcing: The CHARGE and Chart-MRAG Bench are released at https://github.com/Nomothings/CHARGE.git
